comments.body:
Add-ons were cool but they are really inferior compared to mods who are in a whole new level
I really wanna experience java mods so let this be a reality!
i would love that ive been trying to mod minecraft for a while now but i cant because mojang removed modding capability for bedrock.

I really want this back because I really miss having mods in my Minecraft worlds the only way I can enjoy mods is going on YouTube and watch videos of Java and pc players using mods and not the cringe Minecraft Java and pc YouTubers I only watch the non cringe YouTubers.

FYI... I'm not flexing, nor bragging with this comment; just trying to explain myself.

I own both Java and Bedrock editions, on an expensive, high spec computer, and what really kills any incentive for me to play Bedrock, is mainly because I can't install any mods, like I can on Java.

I feel that if Bedrock is made "mod-friendly", I would be more inclined to play... but as of now... what would be the point?
This would be really helpful because I've copied my world and moved the file around I have no idea when the original was made

i actually figured out how to check the date your world was made, only on windows tho, okay so you click on your windows buttem, then type "run" and then type "%localappdata%" -> packages -> Microsoft.MinecraftUWP_8wekyb3d8bbwe -> localState -> games -> com.mojang -> minecraftWorlds -> then theres a bunch of numbers, letters and things like - ?=, these are your worlds, if you double click on one, and then levelname, it says the name of your world, and then when youve found your world, you can see in the like menu of your world, the behavior_packs has the date your world was first made :) i really hope this made sense
My world is roughly 9 years old. I would love to be able to celebrate its birthday

1 A water bar just like your health bar, your experience bar. To replenish your water bar you have to drink from a water bottle to restore 2 bars or drink from a water bucket to restore 5 bars. Just like your health bar uses shanks the water bar should be represented as water bottles. Also your water bar should go down one bar every 15-20 depending on how much you are running, and goes down 2 times faster when your in the desert, and 3 times faster in the nether. You should also be able to hold water bottles in stacks of 64 in order to carry a sufficient amount of water to replenish on. If your water bar goes down all the way you will start to die just like when you have no more food shanks, or when you are drowning you will die.

How do you like this
There should also be a canteen item so you can collect and store water to drink.
Please add a water bar like health bar and a filter so you can‚Äôt drink from the ocean. If you run out, can you loose health? Lastly, please let us place bowls and have rice. Thank you!

I'll upvote. I want to say a few things though.

It seems the first two options would be adding a permanent effect on the soil. I would rather have a game mechanic in place to speed up growth rate or make the farm more durable or less likely to get stepped on. Sower might be fun. With my knowledge of the game mechanics, I don't know if wet soil actually improves farming beyond the chance of that block to revert back to soil. Tiller would be usable, or just add an unbreaking enchantment instead or along with.

Mending would be an option, but I don't think adds much. Some harvesting enchantment would be cool, but I think there is a more unknown tip of using fortune enchanted tools to increase the drop rates of some crops.

I've got things to say for all these things.

Growth - We already have this in the form of Composters and Bees, So it would be a bit overpowered or even obsolete depending on what you have around you.

Bird Protection - First off, The name is iffy and not very accurate considering how little bird type mobs we have. Two, If you are just delicate with your crops or create pathways through it and work with ranged weapons this can be completely obsolete, This would work better if they made a different type of dirt that is more resistant after sowing and harder to break than normal and coarse.

Sower - This would be a very unwieldy enchantment if you are organanized with farming (Which hopefully most people are.) This also would be way too overpowered as it would allow you to gain crops you shouldnt be able to alot earlier than normal. Plus it just doesn't make sense that tilling the ground woukd suddenly summon plants If this was implemented, It couldn't work with Tiller if it somehow got in.

Moisture - This enchantment, I honestly like! Not overly overpowered and would probably be fairly rare being one of the single-level enchantments, Though if Growth somehow ended up getting in, It wouldnt work with this having similar effects though.

Tiller - Like Sower, This would be really unwieldy and difficult to use if you farm organized, If it did get in, It would probably burn up extra durability and only be a perk of speeding up the Tilling process and nothing more.

Now, I'm commenting again as I also have a suggrstion to improve this!

Reaper - Increased Attack Damage and breaks Pumpkins and Watermelons faster, It would induce the same breakspeed upgrade amongst all five levels, But would act like Sharpness otherwise (Since hoes deal the same damage throughout all materials) Though this enchantment would act faster than low grades of Efficiency and be rarer and more expensive to be used by anvils.
Cyal Knight, thanks for the feedback, Sower probably is my favourite too.
I think sower and tiller are a little much but the others I think are great.
you didn't mention it but I think an enchant that automatically replants crops if you mine them with the hoe would be a great addition

Challenge advancements, such as "Return to Sender", give the player experience upon completion. Not to mention that xp is ridiculously easy to get.

Perhaps stripping logs should drop a bark item (new item), which can then be crafted into paper similar to sugar cane, or maybe combined with water similar to concrete making. The bark should have alternative uses, such as combining with a shield to give it the Thorns effect or crafting it with a paper and a dye to create a bark rubbing (piece of custom art displayable in item frames).

I like the idea, but I think that 2-3 pieces of paper are a little too much, especially since there are so many trees in naturally generated terrain. I believe that there should be a chance for the bark to drop one paper. I am thinking 1 in 5. Another option is to have the stripped log always drop one piece of bark, which can be crafted with two others to make one paper.

That would probably be too op. Tbh it would be nice, but im not sure it would make a major difference, it would make building a bit of an issue though, maybe use a different tool for paper then? Or use the wood in a different crafting table for paper would seem to be a more plausible option
Love the idea üëç

definitely too op as is, but its a good idea. I think it should be limited to birch trees, which drop papery bark in real life. right now they are the most useless type of tree/biome, and this would definitely be a good way to make the birch biome more desirable.
You would be pushed to do everything the game has to offer and it could give you 6000 xp, half the dragon, as it is half the game, mine/craft.

You should really make a new update that is just the old pvp, most players are on pvp not pvm so if you want your game to be more popular again (note i love the game) please add the old combat system back pleaseeeeeeeeee so many people would come back to mc.

Great post! I want to expand on this: Starting out very similar to the original post, the more you swing at a mob / player and actually land a hit, the more you will increase your Combo (Even if you're spam-clicking). HOWEVER, the second you swing and MISS, your Combo is reset, completley taking away that advantage you just got. Being hit also very slightly reduces your Combo, but won't overpower the gains of dealing hits (At least not in PvP).

 

This not only gives you the freedom to click as fast as you want, but it also takes skill to be good at. If you just spam-click without good aim, someone can just strafe to dodge you (Or, plain bad aim will do that job for them), and deal way more damage than you. How fast you can hit really depends on your ability to react to your opponent's moves, and that's something that beforehand, either really didn't matter (Pre-1.9), or was severely outweighed by something else (1.9 and beyond).
kinda overrated but i agree, the new combat system sucks!
Maybe there should be a limit to how small the cool-down is, like 0,25 seconds so that it‚Äôs not too op
si.

I prefer the 1.9 combat, becuase the old system just requires fast clicking, but if you can't click more than 8 cps, you'll probably won't be able to win. The cool down should be changed in a proper cooldown, you can't attack if the indicator isn't fully at 100%

Minecraft is a fantasy game, not everything must be real in Minecraft. The point is that you can do whatever you want
Oh boy. Minecraft is not completely based on real life, and that‚Äôs what makes it fun. If you want to make fast travel inconvenient and Minecraft as a whole too realistic, go get a mod.
So, you want Minecraft to become too realistic? Why don‚Äôt we just remove all things unrealistic? Minecraft isn‚Äôt very fun now, isn‚Äôt it?

I hate to be so blunt, but I think this suggestion is terrible. Mojang removed fireflies because they kill frogs in real life, yes, but they did that so that people wouldn't go trying to feed frogs fireflies. The fact that portals can't be made in real life doesn't matter because everybody knows it, nobody will try to build portals out of obsidian. Removing commands because "real life doesn't have them" is also useless, Minecraft isn't real life. It is a video game. Nobody cares if commands don't exist in real life. Finally, Religion in Minecraft just isn't necessary. Over the 12 years Minecraft has been out, not a single person has cared that it might possibly not support their religion.

If The Nether was removed, there would be no Netherite, Eyes of Ender, The Wither, and Nether Quartz. If we didn‚Äôt have The Wither, how would we make a beacon? And commands shouldn‚Äôt be removed. How would map makers (Like me) be able to make maps? It doesn‚Äôt have to be realistic it‚Äôs Minecraft.
literally nobody gives a rats behind about minecraft adding religions, if you want religions, get some friends and make a roleplay SMP. also these ideas are... not good. at all. goodbye.
How is it possible that absolutely no one understood the irony of this feedback? Relax, they're just being humorous to poke fun at Mojang's decision about fireflies by extrapolating that logic.
Y'all it's satire, it's just poking fun at recent decisions made by mojang lol.

I don't know if you know, but Minecraft isn't supposed to be realistic. The fact Minecraft has unrealistic physics, mythical mobs, unrealistic health bars, hunger bars, etc. is the reason why it's so fun. If you make it realistic, you take away Minecraft's plot line and the reason why it's an entertaining and enjoyable game. If you take commands away, it takes so many fun things to do in Minecraft that are also useful. However, if you want realistic Minecraft, just download a bunch of mods and try playing it like that. Plus, the reason why Mojang didn't add fireflies is because it would lag your game a lot. Also, we really don't need or want religions added to Minecraft, it's a really bad idea.
bro what, simply dont play it, the game is a fantasy game
I agree I‚Äôm yet to get one in myself in survival mode but that would be nice
I think the range should increase by the use of more expensive materials, because theres no benefit to using materials like diamond or even netherite in your beacon right now.

To add to this suggestion. The current issue with beacons is that there's no need to build incomplete beacons beyond decoration. A larger max range would make the intermediate ranges also useful. On top of that, builds in Minecraft tend to be much bigger than a beacon's effect range. Having a much larger beacon range would make it so that it's not necessary to spam beacons if you need more coverage. I'd love to see a max range beacon reach maybe a 100 chunks but I can see how there would be tech limitations given the player's render distance.
Please bring this conversation back... Beacons need an update immediately, range-wise they're a shame.
I think they should be able to break end crystals too and armor stands just like arrows do.
